In tapping him to return to the post, Google becomes one of the few major companies in the Valley to be put under the control of a founder after being run for so long by a professional manager. defenses have their work cut out for them trying to get to those guys,'' said John Kuhn , a running back who broke into the NFL taking handoffs from Ben Roethlisberger , but now plays behind Aaron Rodgers . When defenses get to them, it's not over. They've got to get them to the ground. Against Atlanta, Aaron Rodgers made like four or five guys miss in the pocket on several different plays. He's phenomenal. He's playing at a high level right now. But with Ben Roethlisberger , you can't tackle him. He's a beast back there. This move is a big one for ol' Google, as Eric Schmidt , Larry Page and Sergey Brin have long run the company as a trio, an approach Larry Page articulated quite clearly in the company's 2004 IPO filing: We run Google as a triumvirate. The three of us run the company collaboratively with Sergey Brin and me as presidents. The structure is unconventional, but we have worked successfully in this way. Though it goes against Google's well-worn techniques, Shmidt claims the reorganization won't hurt the company's mojo. In fact, he believes the new management structure will speed up the decision making process.

But this might change as it becomes apparent that under-compensation of executives might well be a way to wriggle out of higher payroll tax liability. Dwyane Wade delivered the http://wn.com/Allen Iverson_Allen Iverson_Career_High_60pts_vs_the_Dwight Howard_Dwight Howard_Orlando_Magic_04/05 Three-time scoring champ hits career high Allen Iverson gave the crowd an electrifying performance to remember. Then the fans returned the favor with raucous ovations he won't soon forget. That's when you get the goose bumps, Allen Iverson said.`` You honestly don't really feel it when the shots are going down. You don't ever get the goose bumps until the fans start to appreciate what you're doing out there.''
